messages.subject: Re: [nihontostudy] Polish book
messages.msgSnippet: I bought one when I was in Varsavia 2 years ago. Also a sword book (maybe by the same author). I also got into teh back room of the National Museum to see
messages.messageBody:
I bought one when I was in Varsavia 2 years ago. Also
a sword book (maybe by the same author). I also got
into teh back room of the National Museum to see their
tsuba collection. They had 3 swords, and about 300
tsuba. The lady administrator gave me an autographed
book she had written about Japanese arts. I have meant
to write about that since then. Maybe now I can get
around to it. If you would like I can post the address
of the publisher. Bob Elder

messages.subject: Re: [nihontostudy] Polish book
messages.msgSnippet: Thank you again!! Arnold ... Socha, Henryk.  Elementy broni samurajskiej - Tsuba [Elements of the Arms of the Samurai - The Tsuba], Warsaw:  Dom Wydawnictwo
messages.messageBody:
Thank you again!! Arnold

>>> jdz@... 03/21/05 1:08 PM >>>



Socha, Henryk. Elementy broni samurajskiej - Tsuba [Elements of the
Arms of the Samurai - The Tsuba], Warsaw: Dom Wydawnictwo Bellona,
2003.



It can be purchased via:



http://www.merlin.com.pl/





Merlin is essentially a Polish-language Amazon. Go to: Books (Ksiazki),
then Search (Szukaj), on "tsuba". The only tricky part is typing a
US/Canadian address into the Polish spaces provided.





Hey! look at that, they've eben got abn English-language how to page:



http://www.merlin.com.pl/frontend/static/info/first_purchase/how_to_buy_eng.jsp


----- Original Message -----
From: arnold frenzel
To: nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Monday, March 21, 2005 9:53 AM
Subject: [nihontostudy] Polish book


Hi:
Some months ago there was passing reference to a new publication on
tsuba (and other fittings?) to be published in Poland. Has anyone more
recent information and a source? Thanks. Arnold
